Hi Milt.
Hope so much for you that this beatiful sword will get back to you. I hope that you make the hassle contacting the police, because ebay is the most awful place white-washing money and a place for stolen things where you very eassy get cheeted. My " case " where I boughte a Kiyosada sword from feb. 2004 has just now reached FBI and I am not very possitive about getting the sword I have bought. But I hope that if peable, like I did, report ebay to the police, FBI etc. force ebay to higher the ethical level and make it more secure to use ebay and the Net. All the best wishes for you
Allan

  ViewItem&item=2276357713
  this is the sword " stolen " ( or missing ) from my hotel room in 
  Chicago.
  To keep life simple ,I am trying to buy it back from the seller with 
  no question ask.
  I do have the shinsa worksheet and pics to prove ownership, so please 
  do not bid on this item.
  I don't want the hassle of contacting Chicago Police, e-Bay  etc. if 
  anyone bid and win this " stolen " item.
  Thank you all,

  Milt
